result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Ricardo McGee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
To be determined.  Hearing 9/30/14.
***12-4-14, Judge Dugan, Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to Marie B., in the sum of $900.29 and to Wisconsin Crime Victim Compensation in the sum of $545.63.***

Pay all costs, fees and assessments. Any cash bail to apply. 
AS TO ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid from up to 25% of defendant's prison wages and as a condition of Extended Supervision.   Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Not to possess illegal drugs.
No contact with EJS, her family, residence or employment.
No contact with children under 16 years of age.
No contact with South Milwaukee High School or the South Milwaukee Recreational Center.

Court ordered defendant to be tested for HIV, hepatitis B and STD's with the result turned over to EJS family.
Sex offender assessment. Follow through with recommended programming.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
Defendant shall post on his Facebook page that he was convicted of sexually assaulting a child without naming the child and include in that statement that you were sentenced to prison of the amount of time given.
Pay supervison fees as determined by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Atttend following program and/or assessments:  AODA.  Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.  Undergo random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the data bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus Ricardo McGee in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  Additional statements by Marie B.
AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:  The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 10 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 5 YEARS with credit for 3 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 5 YEARS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of the defendant's prison wages and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  
EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- Possess no illegal drugs.
- No contact with EJS, her family, residence or employment.
- No contact with children under 16 years of age.
- No contact with South Milwaukee High School or the South Milwaukee Recreational Center.
- Court ordered defendant be tested for HIV, Hepatitis B and STD's, with the results turned over to EJS family.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
- Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
- Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
- Defendant shall post on his Facebook page that he was convicted of sexually assaulting a child without naming the child and include in that statement that you were sentenced to prison of the amount of time given.
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
- Pay restitution in an amount to be determined.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 10.

Defendant Marcus Ricardo McGee in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to THIRD DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3), 940.225(4), & 939.50(3)(g), a Class G Felony.
